intro: Callitriche polymorpha f. limicola, commonly known as the marsh stitchwort, is a flowering plant belonging to the Haloragaceae family. It is a submerged aquatic plant that typically grows in shallow, freshwater environments such as ponds, ditches, and wetlands. The plant has small, opposite leaves that are often submerged, with some leaves emerging above the water surface. It produces tiny, white or pale green flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. This variant is adapted to tolerate fluctuating water levels and is often found in nutrient-rich, muddy habitats.
